meanings.sent1: The old castle had a grand wentletrap leading up to the tower.
meanings.sent2: I climbed the wentletrap to reach the top floor of the lighthouse.
meanings.sent3: The wentletrap in the haunted house seemed to twist and turn endlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts spiraled like a wentletrap, never reaching a clear conclusion.
meanings.sent5: The wentletrap in the dream was made of shimmering crystal, casting rainbows on the walls.

meanings.definition: A type of marine snail shell.
meanings.sent1: On the beach, I found a beautiful wentletrap washed up by the waves.
meanings.sent2: The wentletrap shell was delicate and intricately patterned.
meanings.sent3: The hermit crab moved into the wentletrap, thinking it was a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The diver collected rare wentletraps from the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: She held the wentletrap to her ear and heard the sound of the sea.
